system.description: You can stun opponents with unarmed strikes.
system.prerequisites: Dex 13, Wis 13, Improved Unarmed Strike, base attack bonus +8
system.benefit: You must declare that you are using this feat before you make your attack roll (thus, a failed attack roll ruins the attempt). Stunning Fist forces a foe damaged by your unarmed attack to make a Fortitude saving throw (DC 10 + 1/2 your character level + your Wis modifier), in addition to dealing damage normally. A defender who fails this saving throw is stunned for 1 round (until just before your next action). A stunned character can't act, loses any Dexterity bonus to AC, and takes a -2 penalty to AC. You may attempt a stunning attack once per day for every four levels you have attained (see the Stunning Fist table in the SRD), and no more than once per round.
system.special:
A monk may select Stunning Fist as a bonus feat at 1st level.

A fighter may select Stunning Fist as one of his fighter bonus feats.
